intro: Cochranea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cochranea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showsy blooms. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open habitats. Cochranea parviflora is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
